Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; from top: trace of floral motif in added white; band in added red; dot rosette and lotus bud in white outline with red centres; two white lines with red dot below; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of wing with red and back remaining) to left; part of rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0581) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 65 (Other Accession Number)
